titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that the President should designate September 26, 2004, as "National Good Neighbor Day".
A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that the President should designate September 26, 2004, as "National Good Neighbor Day".

action.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Designates September 26, 2004, as National Good Neighbor Day.
